title: The Clonus Horror (1979 - USA) science fiction
description:
The Clonus Horror (1979 - USA)                    aka Parts: The Clonus Horror

Horror / Science Fiction

starring . . . . Peter Graves, Rick DiAngelo, Eugene Robert Glazer
 
http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0078062/


               Academy of Science Fiction, Fantasy & Horror Films
                               - NOMINATED - 
                   Best Film Produced for Under $1,000,000

The film takes place in an isolated desert compound called Clonus, where clones are bred to be used as replacement parts for the elite, including a soon to be president-elect Jeffrey Knight. The clones are kept isolated from the real world by workers of the colony, but are promised to be "accepted" to move to "America" after they have completed some type of physical training.

Director Robert S. Fiveson brought a copyright infringement suit against the makers of The Island (2005). The lawsuit cited 89 points of similarity between "Clonus" and "The Island", and the court ruled that Fiveson made a prima facie case for infringement. Before the case could go to trial, Dreamworks settled with the plaintiffs for an undisclosed amount. It's been rumored that it was a seven-figure sum.


Video: MPEG4 Video (H264), 674x574, 25.000 fps, 2000 Kbps, 01h26m30s
Audio: Dolby AC3, 48000 Hz, stereo, 224 kbps

DVDRip, English audio, no subtitles
